definition: to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: Now it came to pass that Naas the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned is his stead.
sentences.chinese: 此后阿孟子民的君王纳哈士死了，他的儿子继位为王。

sentences.english: After the death of the king, and argues that king.
sentences.chinese: 厉王死了以后，武王继位。

sentences.english: After the death of the king, argues that succeeded.
sentences.chinese: 武王死了以后，文王继位。

sentences.english: Britons want William, not Charles as next king.
sentences.chinese: 英逾六成民众盼威廉王子直接继位。

sentences.english: And Hazael king of Syria died, and Benadad his son reigned in his stead.
sentences.chinese: 阿兰王哈匝耳死后，他的儿子本哈达得继位为王。

sentences.english: After Duan Siying succeeded to the throne, he began to scramble for the power and profit with the Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 而段思英继位后，就开始和相国董迦罗争夺权利。

sentences.english: How Emperor Yongzheng usurping the throne was one of the greatest riddles in history of Qing dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 雍正继位问题是清史上最大的谜案之一。

sentences.english: Queen Mary was succeeded by Elizabeth.
sentences.chinese: 玛利女王之后由伊利莎白一世继位。

sentences.english: There is no interregnum between the death of one sovereign and the accession of the next.
sentences.chinese: 君主死亡与下一君主继位之间不得有任何空位期。

definition: to succeed to a title/to inherit
to confer a title on (an empress or a prince)
